panels.description: No internval server error responses divided by all responses as reported

targets.expr: sum by (service)(irate(api_requests_total{app="$app",code!~"12|13|14",  service=~"$service",region=~"$region", az=~"$az", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by (service)(irate(api_requests_total{app="$app", service=~"$service",region=~"$region", az=~"$az", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Success Rate (no internal server error responses)

panels.description: The number of HTTP requests made in the last 2 minute window

targets.expr: sum(increase(api_requests_total{ app="$app", service=~"$service", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Reqs (2m)

panels.description:
This is the percentage of successful requests over the last minute.

NOTE: Ignoring 404s in this metric, since a  404 is a normal response for errant requests

targets.expr:
sum(rate(api_requests_total{app="$app", service=~"$service",region=~"$region", az=~"$az", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])) / 
(sum(rate(api_requests_total{app="$app", service=~"$service",region=~"$region", az=~"$az", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])) - 
(sum(rate(api_requests_total{app="$app", code!="0", service=~"$service",region=~"$region", az=~"$az", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])) or vector(0)))

panels.title: Success (2m)

panels.description: Green if < 50ms, Yellow if < 100ms, Red if > 100ms
panels.title: Request Latency

panels.description: This is the total number of requests made in this period (top-right period selected)

targets.expr: sum(increase(api_requests_total{ app="$app", service=~"$service", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[${__range_s}s]))

panels.title: Requests (period)

panels.description: The total number of requests made within' each period
panels.title: Total Requests

panels.description: This is a total number of requests broken down.  This can help get a sense of scale in relation to each other.

targets.expr: sum(increase(api_requests_total{ app="$app", service=~"$service", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])) by (api,protocol)

panels.title: Requests / $api-$protocol

panels.description:
The breakdown of the various $protocol  status codes of the requests handled within' this period that matches the variables chosen above.

This chart helps notice and dive into which service is having failures and of what kind.

targets.expr: sum(increase(api_requests_total{ app="$app", service=~"$service", env=~"$env", api=~"$api", protocol=~"$protocol", instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])) by (code)

panels.title: Status Codes($protocol )
